experiment.name: Transcription profiling of Arabidopsis wild type, 35S:mks1 and mpk4 plants

description.text: In plants, MAPKs are implicated in signalling cascades regulating immediate as well as systemic responses to pathogens. Arabidopsis MAP kinase 4 (MPK4) negatively regulates systemic acquired resistance (SAR) accompanied by the expression of pathogenesis-related (PR) genes. MPK4 interacts with and phosphorylates MKS1. Plants that over-express MKS1 exhibit constitutive SAR. RNA was independently isolated three times from each of the three genotypes, wild-type, mpk4 and 35S:mks1 and hybridized to nine Affymetrix ATH1 GeneChips.

bibliography.authors: Erik Andreasson, Thomas Jenkins, Peter Brodersen, Stephan Thorgrimsen, Nikolaj H T Petersen, Shijiang Zhu, Jin-Long Qiu, Pernille Micheelsen, Anne Rocher, Morten Petersen, Mari-Anne Newman, Henrik Bjorn Nielsen, Heribert Hirt, Imre Somssich, Ole Mattsson, and John Mundy
bibliography.title: The MAP kinase substrate MKS1 is a regulator of plant defense responses
